ACF Packet Distribution

Last updated: April 4, 2021

This page lists full-packet distributions for each ACF tournament. Teams submitting full packets to ACF tournaments should follow the prescribed distribution for the tournament they are submitting a packet to.

For tournaments with half-packet submissions, teams will only submit a half-packet of 12/12. Teams that request to submit a half-packet will be given a half-packet submission template containing a list of pre-assigned categories.

Note

The notation âX/Yâ refers to X tossups and Y bonuses (per packet).

Category Fall Winter Regionals Nationals
Literature (total*) 5/5 5/5 5/5 5/5
American Literature 1/1 1/1 1/1 1/1
British Literature 1/1 1/1 1/1 1/1
European Literature after 500 CE 1/1 1/1 1/1 1/1
World Literature 1/0 or 0/1 1/1 1/1 1/1
Any Literature 2/1 or 1/2 1/1 1/1 1/1
History (total*) 5/5 5/5 5/5 5/5
American History 1/1 1/1 1/1 1/1
European History 2/1 or 1/2 2/1 or 1/2 2/1 or 1/2 2/1 or 1/2
World History 1/1 1/1 1/1 1/1
Any History 2/1 or 1/2 2/1 or 1/2 2/1 or 1/2 2/1 or 1/2
Science (total*) 5/5 5/5 5/5 5/5
Biology 1/1 1/1 1/1 1/1
Chemistry 1/1 1/1 1/1 1/1
Physics 1/1 1/1 1/1 1/1
Math, Computer Science, Astronomy, Earth Science 1/1 1/1 1/1 1/1
Any Science 1/1 1/1 1/1 1/1
Fine Arts (total) 3/3 3/3 3/3 3/3
Painting and Sculpture 1/1 1/1 1/1 1/1
Classical Music 1/1 1/1 1/1 1/1
Other Fine Arts 1/1 1/1 1/1 1/1
Religion and Mythology (total) 2/2 2/2 2/2 2/1 or 1/2
Religion 1/1 1/1 1/1 at least 1/0 or 0/1
Mythology 1/1 1/1 1/1 at least 1/0 or 0/1
Social Science and Philosophy (total) 2/1 or 1/2 2/2 2/2 2/2
Social Science 1/0, 0/1, or 1/1 1/1 1/1 1/1
Philosophy 1/0, 0/1, or 1/1 1/1 1/1 1/1
Other (total*) 3/2 or 2/3 2/2 2/2 3/2 or 2/3
Geography 1/0, 0/1, or 1/1 1/0 or 0/1 1/0 or 0/1 at least 1/0 or 0/1
Current Events 1/0, 0/1, or 1/1 1/0 or 0/1 1/0 or 0/1 at least 1/0 or 0/1
Other Academic 1/0, 0/1, or 1/1 1/0 or 0/1 1/0 or 0/1 at least 1/0 or 0/1
Popular Culture 1/0, 0/1, or 1/1 1/0 or 0/1 1/0 or 0/1 0/0
Submitted packet 24/24* 24/24* 24/24* 24/24*
Final packet 20/20 20/20 20/20 20/20

Note

The submitted full-packet distribution adds up to 24/24 in total. To produce final packets of 20/20, the editors will remove 1/1 Literature, 1/1 History, 1/1 Science, and 1/1 Other.

Category Guidelines Â¶ â

Literature Â¶ â

Vary your literature questions across time periods, genre, (novels, poetry, drama, short stories, etc.), and type of answer (authors, individual works, characters, common links, etc.).

World Literature Â¶ â

This includes all geographic regions not listed above.

Any Literature Â¶ â

This includes ancient European literature, more of any of the geographic regions above, or questions that donât neatly fit into a single geographic region.

History Â¶ â

Vary your history questions across time periods and type of history (political, social, military, cultural, etc.). In particular, do not write more than 4 total questions on military history.

European History Â¶ â

One question should be on British/Irish/Canadian/Australian/New Zealand history, the other two should be on continental Europe.

World History Â¶ â

This includes all geographic regions not listed above. Do not write your two questions on history from the same region/continent.

Any History Â¶ â

This includes more of any of the areas of the world covered above, historiography, and questions that donât neatly fit into a single area listed here.

Science Â¶ â

Math, Computer Science, Astronomy, Earth Science Â¶ â

Write questions on two different areas of study.

Any Science Â¶ â

This includes engineering and technology questions that donât fit into any of the fields above, and questions that mix clues/concepts from multiple fields.

You may also write additional questions from one of the âmajorâ fields (biology/chemistry/physics), or you may write a question on a âminorâ field (math/computer science/astronomy/earth science) that you didnât already write on above.

Fine Arts Â¶ â

Painting and Sculpture Â¶ â

You may either write one painting and one sculpture question, or two painting questions.

Other Fine Arts Â¶ â

This includes opera, jazz, architecture, photography, film, dance, etc. Do not write more of the categories above.

Write on one âvisualâ category (architecture, photography, film, etc.) and one âauditoryâ (opera, jazz, dance, etc.) category.

Religion and Mythology Â¶ â

Write at least one and no more than two questions on non-Western topics.

Religion Â¶ â

Warning

Do not write two questions on the same religion.

Mythology Â¶ â

Warning

Do not write two questions on the same mythological system.

Social Science and Philosophy Â¶ â

Social Science Â¶ â

Topics for this category include:

  • Economics
  • Psychology
  • Sociology
  • Anthropology
  • Linguistics
  • Political science
  • Social criticism
  • Law (although questions on individual Supreme Court cases go in History)

Important

Write questions on two different fields of study.

Philosophy Â¶ â

Write questions on two different movements/time periods in philosophical history.

Other Â¶ â

For Fall, Winter, and Regionals: Write one question in each of Geography, Current Events, Other Academic, and Popular Culture.

For Nationals: Write at least one question in each of Geography, Current Events, and Other Academic.

Other Academic Â¶ â

âOther Academicâ comprises questions that donât neatly fit into any of the above categories, such as:

  • Interdisciplinary common links
  • Miscellaneous thought
  • Science history
  • etc.

You may also choose to write an additional question in any category here instead.
